Just checked what this looked like on macOS. For some whenever we set explicit font sizes in macOS, they come out looking smaller than on other OSs. Hence why the outputbox has a font size that depends on the OS.

Here’s what this change looks like:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BMBAeq/images/2024146306-lyse_7_8.png)
It’s a bit tiny. How about bumping both header font sizes up by 2pt each? That’s what I decided on for the OutputBox: it is  11pt on Windows and Linux, and 13pt on macOS - this ended up looking about the same size relative to other UI elements.

So you would want something like:

```
        font.setPointSize(10 if sys.platform == 'darwin' else 8)
        self._header.setFont(font)
        font.setPointSize(9 if sys.platform == 'darwin' else 7)
        font.setFamily('Ubuntu Mono')
        self._vertheader.setFont(font)
```

And then it looks more like:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BMBAeq/images/3639805373-lyse_9_10.png)
So slightly more readable.
